posts.title: Neten Dorji While nursing has been viewed as a profession best suited to students from sc...
posts.description: Neten Dorji While nursing has been viewed as a profession best suited to students from science backgrounds, educators say that perception is outdated, and that students from arts and commerce streams are proving just as capable. The Apollo Bhutan Institute of Nursing and the Arura Nursing Institute have both begun admitting arts and commerce students to General Nursing and Midwifery (GNM) programmes, aligning with global practices. https://kuenselonline.com/.../non-science-students-show... #nursing #GNM #Bhutan

posts.title: Foreign manufacturers face fees, inspections under the strict certification regime Dorji ...
posts.description: Foreign manufacturers face fees, inspections under the strict certification regime Dorji Choden Starting next year, only products certified by the Bhutan Standards Bureau (BSB) will be permitted for import into Bhutan. This rule is based on the Bhutan Standards Act 2010, which gives BSB the authority to stop the import of products that do not meet national standards unless the product is made to even higher standards. https://kuenselonline.com/.../only-bsb-certified-products... #BSB #Bhutan

posts.title: Editorial: Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country
posts.description: Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils—including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https://kuenselonline.com/news/a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan
posts.content: Editorial: Alcohol remains one of the biggest social problems in our country. Solutions are rare, even though this substance has long been identified as a root cause of many evils—including in the teachings of Lord Buddha. While we may not be able to eliminate alcohol completely, a small initiative could make a big difference: protecting our children from early exposure to it. https://kuenselonline.com/news/a-pledge-we-must-all-make #alcohol #editorial #Bhutan

posts.title: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 p...
posts.description: Update: The three-day Annual Media Workshop 2025 began today in Paro, bringing together over 37 participants, including media professionals, officials from the Ministry of Health, WHO Bhutan, Dratshang Lhentshog, and Civil Society Organisations. Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that “a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered.” He emphasized the media’s vital role in bridging science and society, countering misinformation, and shaping healthier communities. Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh (PhD), WHO Representative to Bhutan, in her remarks today highlighted the crucial role of media in driving advocacy, awareness, and behavior change in public health. Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth

Source: WHO Bhutan #HealthForAll #MediaWorkshop2025 #Bhutan #HealthCommunication #ResilientSystems #PartnershipsForHealth

posts.title: Breaking: AFC Challenge League Group Stage to be held in Bhutan as Paro FC advances The Asian Foo...
posts.description: Breaking: AFC Challenge League Group Stage to be held in Bhutan as Paro FC advances The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) has confirmed that Bhutan will host the group stage of the AFC Challenge League in Thimphu, following Paro FC’s emphatic victory over Abu Muslim in the preliminary round. The win propels Paro FC into history once again, as the club becomes the first Bhutanese team to host an AFC League fixture in the capital for the second time. The official fixture draw is scheduled for August 28, 2025, when Paro FC will learn their next opponent. Match dates and kick-off times will be announced after the draw.

The win propels Paro FC into history once again, as the club becomes the first Bhutanese team to host an AFC League fixture in the capital for the second time. The official fixture draw is scheduled for August 28, 2025, when Paro FC will learn their next opponent. Match dates and kick-off times will be announced after the draw.

posts.title: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airline...
posts.description: A total of 6,203 tourists benefitted from subsidised fares during the period Sherab Lhamo Airlines have been instructed to discontinue the subsidised airfare scheme for tourists, following a directive issued by the Department of Tourism (DoT) in August. The order, according to Drukair CEO Tandi Wangchuk, came from the Ministry of Finance. He said that the DoT is working to reimburse airlines for tickets already sold under the scheme. https://kuenselonline.com/.../government-discontinues... #DoT #Tourism #TCB #Bhutan

posts.title: Perspective: ’       I arrived in Bhutan for the 2025 Bhutan Echoes literary festival expecting p...
posts.description: Perspective: ’       I arrived in Bhutan for the 2025 Bhutan Echoes literary festival expecting postcard beauty–the valleys, the mountains, the wind-tossed prayer flags. What I found was a deeper national treasure: a culture where kindness is instinct, and strangers become friends before you know their names. https://kuenselonline.com/.../bhutans-bold-step-toward... #GMC #GNH #GDP #Bhutan

posts.title: ‘               ’ Our vision is to make Paro FC synonymous with excellence in Bhutanese football
posts.description: . We aspire to be a club that consistently represents Bhutan at the AFC level and competes against some of the best teams in Asia. Beyond football results, we want to create a professionally managed, financially sustainable club with modern infrastructure and strong governance. A key part of this vision is to establish a high-standard academy that nurtures local players into future national stars. At the same time, we aim to build a passionate and loyal fan base, making Paro FC a benchmark for professional football in Bhutan. https://kuenselonline.com/.../our-vision-is-to-show... #sports #ParoFC #football #Bhutan

posts.title: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties’ ongoing State Visit to Việt Nam, His Majesty The King and He...
posts.description: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties’ ongoing State Visit to Việt Nam, His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen paid tribute to President Hồ Chí Minh — the founder of modern Việt Nam, and to the nation’s war heroes and martyrs. Their Majesties visited the Monument to Heroes and Martyrs to honour Việt Nam’s fallen heroes, and the Hồ Chí Minh Mausoleum, the final resting place of the revolutionary leader. Their Majesties were then received in an official ceremony by President Lương Cường and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt at the Presidential Palace with a Guard of Honour. His Majesty The King held a meeting with the President of Việt Nam, accompanied by the delegation from Bhutan. Two Memoranda of Understanding between Bhutan and Việt Nam on cooperation between the two governments and cooperation in aviation were signed in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Việt Nam. Meanwhile, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt visited Trấn Quốc Pagoda, the oldest Buddhist temple in Hà Nội. Her Majesty and the First Lady were received by the abbot, Most Venerable Thích Thanh Nhã, and offered incense and prayers at the temple. In the afternoon, His Majesty met with the General Secretary of the Communist Party of Việt Nam Tô Lâm, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính, and Chairman of the National Assembly Trần Thanh Mẫn. In the evening, the President and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt hosted a State Banquet in honour of Their Majesties. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck
posts.content: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties’ ongoing State Visit to Việt Nam, His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen paid tribute to President Hồ Chí Minh — the founder of modern Việt Nam, and to the nation’s war heroes and martyrs. Their Majesties visited the Monument to Heroes and Martyrs to honour Việt Nam’s fallen heroes, and the Hồ Chí Minh Mausoleum, the final resting place of the revolutionary leader. Their Majesties were then received in an official ceremony by President Lương Cường and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt at the Presidential Palace with a Guard of Honour. His Majesty The King held a meeting with the President of Việt Nam, accompanied by the delegation from Bhutan. Two Memoranda of Understanding between Bhutan and Việt Nam on cooperation between the two governments and cooperation in aviation were signed in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Việt Nam. Meanwhile, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt visited Trấn Quốc Pagoda, the oldest Buddhist temple in Hà Nội. Her Majesty and the First Lady were received by the abbot, Most Venerable Thích Thanh Nhã, and offered incense and prayers at the temple. In the afternoon, His Majesty met with the General Secretary of the Communist Party of Việt Nam Tô Lâm, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính, and Chairman of the National Assembly Trần Thanh Mẫn. In the evening, the President and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt hosted a State Banquet in honour of Their Majesties. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck

posts.title: Update of His Majesty’s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Servic...
posts.description: Update of His Majesty’s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation
posts.content: Update of His Majesty’s State Visit to Vietnam: A Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) on Air Services Agreement was signed on August 19, 2025 between the Ministry of Infrastructure and Transport, Bhutan and the Civil Aviation Authority, Ministry of Construction, The Government of the Socialist Republic of Viet Nam in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Viet Nam. The objective of the MoU is to promote aeronautical relations in a spirit of cooperation and understanding for the benefit of both countries. #Update #energy #Aviation

Delivering the keynote address, Health Minister Lyonpo Tandin Wangchuk stressed that  a resilient and equitable health system is not built by health professionals alone, but by a society that is informed, engaged, and empowered. posts.title: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties  ongoing State Visit to Việt Nam, His Majesty The King and He...
posts.description: August 19, 2025: On Their Majesties  ongoing State Visit to Việt Nam, His Majesty The King and Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen paid tribute to President Hồ Chí Minh   the founder of modern Việt Nam, and to the nation s war heroes and martyrs. Their Majesties visited the Monument to Heroes and Martyrs to honour Việt Nam s fallen heroes, and the Hồ Chí Minh Mausoleum, the final resting place of the revolutionary leader. Their Majesties were then received in an official ceremony by President Lương Cường and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt at the Presidential Palace with a Guard of Honour. His Majesty The King held a meeting with the President of Việt Nam, accompanied by the delegation from Bhutan. Two Memoranda of Understanding between Bhutan and Việt Nam on cooperation between the two governments and cooperation in aviation were signed in the presence of His Majesty The King and the President of Việt Nam. Meanwhile, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt visited Trấn Quốc Pagoda, the oldest Buddhist temple in Hà Nội. Her Majesty and the First Lady were received by the abbot, Most Venerable Thích Thanh Nhã, and offered incense and prayers at the temple. In the afternoon, His Majesty met with the General Secretary of the Communist Party of Việt Nam Tô Lâm, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính, and Chairman of the National Assembly Trần Thanh Mẫn. In the evening, the President and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt hosted a State Banquet in honour of Their Majesties. Source: His Majesty King Jigme Khesar Namgyel Wangchuck

Meanwhile, Her Majesty The Gyaltsuen and Madame Nguyễn Thị Minh Nguyệt visited Trấn Quốc Pagoda, the oldest Buddhist temple in Hà Nội. Her Majesty and the First Lady were received by the abbot, Most Venerable Thích Thanh Nhã, and offered incense and prayers at the temple. In the afternoon, His Majesty met with the General Secretary of the Communist Party of Việt Nam Tô Lâm, Prime Minister Phạm Minh Chính, and Chairman of the National Assembly Trần Thanh Mẫn. posts.title: Just in: The Supreme Court upheld the earlier rulings, confirming Tashi Dorji s conviction for a ...
posts.description: Just in: The Supreme Court upheld the earlier rulings, confirming Tashi Dorji s conviction for a fourth-degree felony and affirming the High Court s sentence of three years and four months in prison. The verdict was passed today. The former MP Tashi Dorji of Nubi_Tangsibji consituency in Trongsa was charged for molesting a child in 2022. The incident occurred when he was serving as a Gewog Administrative Officer. The case was filed in court in October last year.
posts.content: Just in: The Supreme Court upheld the earlier rulings, confirming Tashi Dorji s conviction for a fourth-degree felony and affirming the High Court s sentence of three years and four months in prison. The verdict was passed today. The former MP Tashi Dorji of Nubi_Tangsibji consituency in Trongsa was charged for molesting a child in 2022. The incident occurred when he was serving as a Gewog Administrative Officer. The case was filed in court in October last year.
